instruction: Write a NASM x86-64 Linux program that exits with code 77.
reference_solution:
global _start
section .text
_start:
    mov rdi, 77
    mov rax, 60
    syscall

instruction: Write a NASM x86-64 Linux program that prints exactly 'error\n'.
reference_solution:
global _start
section .data
    msg db 'error', 10
    len equ $ - msg
section .text
_start:
    mov rax, 1
    mov rdi, 1
    mov rsi, msg
    mov rdx, len
    syscall
    mov rax, 60
    xor rdi, rdi
    syscall

instruction: Write a NASM x86-64 Linux program that computes 17 + 25 and exits with the result (42) as the exit code.
reference_solution:
global _start
section .text
_start:
    mov rax, 17
    add rax, 25
    mov rdi, rax
    mov rax, 60
    syscall

instruction: Write a NASM x86-64 Linux program that computes 9 * 9 and exits with the result (81) as the exit code.
reference_solution:
global _start
section .text
_start:
    mov rax, 9
    imul rax, rax, 9
    mov rdi, rax
    mov rax, 60
    syscall

instruction: Write a NASM x86-64 Linux program that computes 200 - 100 and exits with the result (100) as the exit code.
reference_solution:
global _start
section .text
_start:
    mov rax, 200
    sub rax, 100
    mov rdi, rax
    mov rax, 60
    syscall

instruction: Write a NASM x86-64 Linux program that computes 84 / 2 using idiv and exits with the result (42) as the exit code.
reference_solution:
global _start
section .text
_start:
    mov rax, 84
    xor rdx, rdx
    mov rcx, 2
    idiv rcx
    mov rdi, rax
    mov rax, 60
    syscall

instruction: Write a NASM x86-64 Linux program that computes max(45, 30) using cmp/cmov and exits with the result (45) as the exit code.
reference_solution:
global _start
section .text
_start:
    mov rax, 45
    mov rcx, 30
    cmp rax, rcx
    cmovl rax, rcx
    mov rdi, rax
    mov rax, 60
    syscall

instruction: Write a NASM x86-64 Linux program that sums numbers from 1 to 15 using a loop and exits with the result (120) as the exit code.
reference_solution:
global _start
section .text
_start:
    xor rax, rax
    mov rcx, 1
.loop:
    add rax, rcx
    inc rcx
    cmp rcx, 16
    jl .loop
    mov rdi, rax
    mov rax, 60
    syscall

instruction: Write a NASM x86-64 Linux program that computes the 7th Fibonacci number F(7)=13 (1-indexed: F(1)=1, F(2)=1) using a loop and exits with the result as the exit code.
reference_solution:
global _start
section .text
_start:
    mov rax, 1
    mov rbx, 1
    mov rcx, 2
.loop:
    cmp rcx, 7
    jge .done
    mov rdx, rax
    add rax, rbx
    mov rbx, rdx
    inc rcx
    jmp .loop
.done:
    mov rdi, rax
    mov rax, 60
    syscall

instruction: Write a NASM x86-64 Linux program that sums odd numbers from 1 to 9 (1+3+5+7+9=25) using a loop and exits with the result (25) as the exit code.
reference_solution:
global _start
section .text
_start:
    xor rax, rax
    mov rcx, 1
.loop:
    add rax, rcx
    add rcx, 2
    cmp rcx, 10
    jl .loop
    mov rdi, rax
    mov rax, 60
    syscall

instruction: Write a NASM x86-64 Linux program that loops 6 times, adding 5 each iteration starting from 0, and exits with the final value (30) as the exit code.
reference_solution:
global _start
section .text
_start:
    xor rax, rax
    mov rcx, 6
.loop:
    add rax, 5
    dec rcx
    jnz .loop
    mov rdi, rax
    mov rax, 60
    syscall

instruction: Write a NASM x86-64 Linux program that computes 2^6 = 64 using a multiplication loop and exits with the result as the exit code.
reference_solution:
global _start
section .text
_start:
    mov rax, 1
    mov rcx, 6
.loop:
    imul rax, rax, 2
    dec rcx
    jnz .loop
    mov rdi, rax
    mov rax, 60
    syscall
